The study cited in the claim was conduct: not COVID-19, and therefore cannot be directly applied to the effectiveness of face masks in preventing the spread of COVID-19.
The study was published by the Universit: not the CDC and WHO, although there are affiliations.
One of the authors of the study: Professor Ben Cowling, stated that the claim is an incorrect interpretation of the study and that it confuses absence of evidence with evidence of absence.
Virologist Angela Rasmussen pointed out: but this does not prove that face masks do not prevent transmission. More studies are needed to fully understand the effectiveness of masks in reducing community transmission.
